com.camerontec.catalys.server

Class CatalysServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.CatalysServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public class CatalysServer
extends AbstractConfigurable
    Threading model:
    1. Server connection threads: one thread for each socket listening port and one thread for each anonymous session until the party is identified (managed by ServerConnectionManager).
    2. Client connection threads: one thread for each party which maintains client connections (managed by IClientConnectionManager).
    3. Session Manager threads: one thread for each party session manager.
    Each server connection thread listens for connections on one port. When a connection is made it creates an anonymous session with a PartyIdentifier listener. When the PartyIdentifier identifies the party associated with the session, it configures the session for that party and then hands the session to its manager.

    Each client connection thread tries to keep one connection open for its party. Once a connection is established, a session for the party is created over the connection and the session is passed to its manager. From then on the thread simply checks periodically that the connection is still good.

    A Session Manager thread is used to send and receive messages over its session. It can also be used to reset sequence numbers at predetermined times. If it detects that the underlying connection has failed, it closes the session and underlying connection. The fact that the connection is no longer working will be picked up by the party's connection thread which will then try to reestablish the connection.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ARG_CLUSTER_NODE
      This argument defines the cluster node of the application when running in high availability mode.
      static String ARG_CONFIGURATION_FILE_NAME
      This argument defines the XML configuration file for the server.
      static String ARG_DO_NOT_BACKUP_CONFIGURATION
      This argument tells the Configuration writer not to create any backup
      static String ARG_LOCK
      This argument is used to start all sessions as LOCKED
      static String ARG_RESET_SEQ
      This argument is used reset sequence numbers on logon.
      static String ARG_SKIP_XML_VALIDATION
      If this argument is present, we skip the XML validation (against DTD/Schema) when parsing the XML config.
      static int EXIT_LEVEL_DO_NOT_EXIT
      The exit level set if the process should not exit.
      static int EXIT_LEVEL_OK
      The exit level set if a normal process shutdown occurred.
      static int EXIT_LEVEL_START_FAILED
      The exit level set if there was a failure to start the server.

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • getConfiguration

        public IConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Return the last valid configuration.
        Returns:
        Reference to the last IConfiguration used to successfully configure this IConfigurable.

      • getShutdownThread

        public final Thread getShutdownThread()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(int level)
        Shut down the server. This includes:
        1. Deactivation of all components.
        2. Shutdown of the command line.
        3. Process exit at given level (if specified level is not EXIT_LEVEL_DO_NOT_EXIT).
        Parameters:
        level - the exit level.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Start the application.
        Parameters:
        args - see usage
